settings.content: Contributing to a sustainable future for our children and our planet is a key tenet of our mission at 12|12.  Through our partnership with Baby2Baby, we aim to provide comfortable, modern clothing essentials for all children, not just those who can afford them.  But we also understand that our promise to do so is only as good as our parallel commitment to protect our environment.  At 12|12, our sustainability goal is to responsibly and ethically produce the highest quality children’s clothing product, while continuously seeking ways to reduce our environmental impact.

Contributing to a sustainable future for our children and our planet is a key tenet of our mission at 12|12.  Through our partnership with Baby2Baby, we aim to provide comfortable, modern clothing essentials for all children, not just those who can afford them.  But we also understand that our promise to do so is only as good as our parallel commitment to protect our environment.  At 12|12, our sustainability goal is to responsibly and ethically produce the highest quality children’s clothing product, while continuously seeking ways to reduce our environmental impact.

settings.title: Our Sustainability Path
settings.content: From the launch of our very first collection, 12|12 has been committed to making an environmentally-friendly product, which is why we have always used organic cotton from day one.  As the company has grown, we have also grown our sustainability efforts.  The information below describes our current efforts to use environmentally-responsible materials and practices whenever possible. This work is ongoing as we continue to learn more about how we can expand our sustainability even further.  We make this information available to our customers and followers with the goal of being transparent throughout our sustainability journey.

settings.title: Our Raw Materials
settings.content:
GOTS-Certified Organic Cotton: Certified organic pima cotton is the cornerstone of our product at 12|12.  We source organic Peruvian pima cotton, widely known as the finest cotton in the world, organically grown and harvested exclusively in the coastal valleys of Peru. 
We also choose organic cotton for its minimal impact on the environment.  We use GOTS-certified organic pima cotton whenever possible.  The Global Organic Textile Standard (GOTS) is the leading worldwide textile processing standard for organic fibers, meaning natural fibers grown without the use of synthetic pesticides, insecticides/herbicides and GMOs.  We choose organic agriculture because it is a production process that sustains the health of ecosystems, soils and the people who work and live in the surrounding communities. We are proud to say that over 90% of our current collection is made from organic pima cotton.

Oeko-Tex Dyes: Our organic cotton fabric is then dyed and printed using only OEKO-TEX 100 standard dyes, meaning they are certified free of over 100 substances known to be toxic and harmful to people and the environment.  OEKO-TEX is a different, yet equally important, global textile standard from GOTS.  We believe that adhering to both certifications along our supply chain process makes for the safest product for our customers, our supply chain partners and ultimately our planet.

Recycled Fabric: Beginning in 2021, we began incorporating recycled material in the production process of select styles.  We have been able to offer our customer a swim product that is made of 74% recycled material, via our environmentally-conscious production partner in this category.  Incorporating more recycled material in our products is a longer-term goal that we continue to research and pursue.  We are also seeking ways to reduce unusable fabric waste by turning fabric cuttings into new styles, such as headbands and other accessories.

settings.title: Our Partner Factories
settings.content: As a small, women-owned and operated company, 12|12 seeks to support other small makers and businesses via our factory partnerships. We take great care when selecting our factory partners, seeking high standards of craftsmanship and responsible manufacturing. These are deeply valued partnerships that we have developed over several years. 12|12 is currently working with three factories around the world.  Located in Peru, China and the USA, each factory is a small 100% family-owned and vertically integrated factory. Whenever possible, we choose to ship our finished goods from our partner factories to our warehouse in New York using sea freight as the preferred mode of transport, thereby helping to reduce carbon emissions from air freight.

settings.title: Our Packaging
settings.content:
This year in particular, we have given careful consideration to the sustainability of our packaging materials.  Nearly all of our various packaging materials now contain recycled content, with the exception of the plastic polybags we use to protect our product during shipping (which we must do to ensure that product arrives to our customers in a state that is always pristine and sanitary).  Below is sustainability information regarding our packaging materials in 2021: 

Mailers: We use only 100% recycled poly mailers to ship our product to our customers.  For larger orders, we use a 100% recycled shipping box that is also fully curbside recyclable.

Tissue: Our printed tissue paper is made of 100% recycled paper.

Cards: All card paper is made of 100% recycled content, is FSC certified and curbside recyclable.

settings.title: Our Design Process
settings.content:
Last but not least, we design and produce our collections in small batches with the intention of selling out each and every time. Any unsold product in donated to children in need via our partnership with Baby2Baby. No unsold product is ever thrown away or destroyed. We are also careful to only order protos and photo samples as needed. 

At 12|12, we also believe that the best way to shop sustainably is to invest in quality pieces that can be worn again and again, and then passed down to others once outgrown. As parents ourselves, we know that the messy fun of being a kid can be tough on clothing, but we also hope to design products that are timeless and durable enough to become heirloom products. Nothing makes us happier than hearing that a cozy 12|12 footed PJ or a much-loved terry pullover has found a second life with a baby sibling or a younger family friend.

settings.subheading: Organic and sustainable essentials designed to be lived in, played in, and snoozed in – 12 hours a day, 12 hours a night.

settings.title: Get in touch
settings.content: Please feel free to reach out to us with questions or even any ideas you might have on further reducing our environmental impact at 12|12.  We would love for this to be an open dialogue and are always eager to further our own education on sustainable business practices.
